Title:
Generic delimitation of Erioscyphella (Lachnaceae,
Helotiales, Ascomycota) with proposal of new taxa and new
combinations
Abstract:
The generic delimitation and concept for the tropical
genus Erioscyphella Kirschst. previously morphologically ill-defined was
examined using increased taxa. The molecular phylogenetic analysis using
the combined dataset of ITS, LSU, mtSSU and RPB2, and morphological
examination revealed Erioscyphella can be defined mainly focusing on the
length of ascospores and hair-structures, but still contains some
species presenting exceptional morphology. Five new species and three
new combination were proposed. With the addition of new taxa,
Erioscyphella was proved to have high species diversity also in the
temperate to subarctic zone in the Northern hemisphere.
